title: Improve Zombie Models to Look Like Call of Duty-Style Zombies

requirements.summary: Redesign StandardZombie mesh to resemble a Call of Duty-style zombie with humanoid anatomy, torn clothing, skull-like head with sunken eyes, and necrotic color palette
acceptanceCriteria: StandardZombie has a distinct head, torso, two arms, and two legs as separate mesh segments
Head geometry includes sunken/hollow eye socket detail (dark recessed geometry)
Body parts use a pale greenish-grey toon-shaded color matching a CoD undead aesthetic
Torn clothing is represented by overlapping dark-brown/black geometric planes on the torso and arms
Blood accents (dark red) are present on clothing/body segments
Walking bob animation still functions correctly on the new mesh
Hit flash and death fade effects still apply correctly to the new mesh

file_operations.description: Replace the StandardZombie mesh geometry with a multi-segment humanoid structure: create separate BoxGeometry segments for head (with skull-like proportions), torso, upper arms, forearms, thighs, and shins; add dark recessed CylinderGeometry for sunken eye sockets; add overlapping PlaneGeometry segments on torso and arms to represent torn/ragged clothing with dark-brown/black colors; add small dark-red BoxGeometry accents for blood stains on clothing; update toon material colors to pale greenish-grey (#a8b5a0 range) for skin and dark-brown (#3a2f28) for clothing; ensure all segments are grouped correctly and positioned to form a cohesive humanoid silhouette; verify existing walking bob animation, hit flash, and death fade logic apply to the new multi-segment mesh structure

requirements.summary: Redesign BossZombie mesh as a heavily mutated CoD boss zombie with larger bulk, deformed skull, exposed bone geometry, glowing eyes, and darker necrotic tones
acceptanceCriteria: BossZombie is visually larger and more imposing than StandardZombie
BossZombie has an oversized deformed skull with emissive glowing red eye geometry
Chest area includes exposed rib/bone geometry (light-grey protruding planes)
Shoulders are asymmetric and bulkier than the standard zombie
Arms are elongated/oversized relative to the body
BossZombie uses a darker, more decayed skin tone than StandardZombie
Existing hit flash, wave bob, and death fade animations still function on the new mesh

file_operations.description: Replace the BossZombie mesh geometry with a mutated boss structure: scale up the overall size by 1.4–1.6x relative to StandardZombie; create an enlarged deformed skull (wider and taller BoxGeometry with uneven proportions); add two small SphereGeometry elements for glowing red eyes with MeshBasicMaterial (emissive red, no lighting) positioned in sunken sockets; build a bulkier torso with asymmetric shoulder masses (one shoulder larger/higher than the other using BoxGeometry); add exposed rib/bone geometry on the chest using thin light-grey PlaneGeometry segments arranged in rib-cage pattern; create elongated oversized arms (longer forearm and upper-arm segments); use a darker necrotic skin tone (#6a7565 range, darker than StandardZombie); add torn dark clothing similar to StandardZombie but more heavily damaged; ensure all segments are grouped and positioned for cohesive boss silhouette; verify existing hit flash, wave bob, and death fade animations work correctly on the new multi-segment boss mesh

requirements.summary: Add subtle idle sway/lurch animation to both zombie types with forward torso lean and side-to-side arm swing to mimic CoD zombie movement
acceptanceCriteria: Both zombie types have a forward torso lean of approximately 15–25 degrees
Arms hang lower and swing side-to-side during the walk animation
The lurch animation is driven by the existing frame-based animation system (useFrame)
Animation does not cause performance regression (no new per-frame allocations)

file_operations.description: Add idle lurch animation to both StandardZombie and BossZombie: apply a static forward rotation of 0.26–0.44 radians (15–25 degrees) to the torso group to create a hunched-forward posture; in the existing useFrame animation loop, add a slow sinusoidal side-to-side shoulder sway (modify arm group rotations based on time with a period of ~2–3 seconds and amplitude of ~0.1 radians); ensure arms hang lower by adjusting their rest position downward; layer this lurch animation on top of the existing walking bob animation without conflicting with hit flash or death fade effects; validate no new object allocations occur per frame (reuse existing time/delta values)
